title: Relates to the use of disposable, plastic bags by supermarket or grocery store chains with five or more stores
summary: Relates to the use of disposable, plastic bags by supermarket or grocery store chains with five or more stores; imposes violations for the failure to conduct certain training of the use of such disposable, plastic bags.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1814

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. JAFFEE, GUNTHER, COLTON, SPANO, LUPARDO, GALEF,
         KELLNER, SCHIMEL -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A.  BOYLAND,  BRENNAN,
         GIGLIO, GLICK, GOTTFRIED, REILLY, WEISENBERG -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Environmental Conservation

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  general business law, in relation to the use of
         plastic bags by supermarket or grocery store chains with five or  more
         stores

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.   The general business law  is  amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  section 399-j to read as follows:
    3    S  399-J.  USE  OF  DISPOSABLE,  PLASTIC  BAGS.  1. ANY SUPERMARKET OR
    4  GROCERY STORE WITH FIVE OR MORE STORES IN A CHAIN SHALL CONDUCT TRAINING
    5  FOR ALL EMPLOYEES WHO WORK ON A CHECKOUT LINE AND/OR  CASH  REGISTER  TO
    6  DEVELOP  AWARENESS ABOUT THE AMOUNT OF DISPOSABLE, PLASTIC BAGS USED PER
    7  ORDER AND TO KEEP THE DISTRIBUTION WITHIN REASONABLE LIMITS. SUCH TRAIN-
    8  ING SHALL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, REUSING BRAND NEW  DISPOSABLE,
    9  PLASTIC  BAGS  THAT  A CUSTOMER DECLINES INSTEAD OF THROWING THEM IN THE
   10  TRASH AND WHAT CONSTITUTES REASONABLE USE  LIMITS  OF  SUCH  DISPOSABLE,
   11  PLASTIC BAGS.
   12    2.  ANY  VIOLATION  OF  THIS  SECTION WHERE ANY SUPERMARKET OR GROCERY
   13  STORE CHAIN OF FIVE STORES OR MORE FAILS TO CONDUCT SUCH TRAINING  SHALL
   14  RECEIVE  A  FINE OF ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS AND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS FOR ANY
   15  SUBSEQUENT VIOLATION FOR REPEATED FAILURE TO CONDUCT TRAINING.
   16    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05556-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to the use of plastic bags by supermarket or grocery store chains with five or more stores
